intro: Loxanthocereus neglectus var. chimbotensis, commonly known as the Chimboté cactus, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its spiny stems and ability to store water in its thick, fleshy tissues. The plant produces showy, night-blooming flowers that are typically pale yellow or white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
